pull.title: net: Add Clang thread safety annotations for guarded variables in the networking code
pull.body:
Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by:
* `cs_addrLocal`
* `cs_addrName`
* `cs_feeFilter`
* `cs_filter`
* `cs_hSocket`
* `cs_inventory`
* `cs_mapLocalHost`
* `cs_most_recent_block`
* `cs_proxyInfos`
* `cs_sendProcessing`
* `cs_setBanned`
* `cs_SubVer`
* `cs_vOneShots`
* `cs_vProcessMsg`
* `cs_vRecv`
* `cs_vSend`

Changed files:
* `src/net.{cpp,h}`
* `src/netbase.cpp`

rename.from: Add Clang thread safety annotations for guarded variables in the networking code
rename.to: net: Add Clang thread safety annotations for guarded variables in the networking code

events.body: Imo could squash everything, since most of the commits only touch 2 lines.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14605](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14605.html) (Return of the Banman by dongcarl)
* [#14046](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14046.html) (net: Refactor message parsing (CNetMessage), adds flexibility by jonasschnelli)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

utACK 4894133dc5095ed971bf98d695384e7cbb16e54c

* Checked that where the lock is added is also a place where tsan would complain [1]
* Checked that the lock annotations don't change the objdump of the bitcoind, compiled with gcc or clang on my system


[1]

```
WARNING: ThreadSanitizer: data race (pid=30947)
  Read of size 8 at 0x7d6c0005e688 by thread T12 (mutexes: write M131981):
    #0 CNode::copyStats(CNodeStats&) /bitcoin/src/net.cpp:718 (bitcoind+0x0000005224e5)
    #1 CConnman::GetNodeStats(std::vector<CNodeStats, std::allocator<CNodeStats> >&) /bitcoin/src/net.cpp:2567 (bitcoind+0x0000005346b7)
    #2 getpeerinfo(JSONRPCRequest const&) /bitcoin/src/rpc/net.cpp:131 (bitcoind+0x000000617137)

...

  Previous write of size 8 at 0x7d6c0005e688 by thread T19 (mutexes: write M134272):
    #0 ProcessMessage(CNode*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, CDataStream&, long, CChainParams const&, CConnman*, std::atomic<bool> const&, bool) /bitcoin/src/net_processing.cpp:2927 (bitcoind+0x000000562dc8)
@practicalswift why are `nNextAddrSend` and `nNextLocalAddrSend` now guarded by `cs_sendProcessing`? I don't think those things should be connected.
@jnewbery I agree that sure looks like an error! Good catch!
Thanks for the quick reply. I have a PR moving some of those fields around, so I'll get rid of the lock annotations there.
@jnewbery Thanks a lot for fixing (and finding)! Much appreciated!
@practicalswift sorry I meant to say that I have a branch that moves the fields around that I haven't PR'ed yet. I'll ping you when the PR is open.

> @practicalswift sorry I meant to say that I have a branch that moves the fields around that I haven't PR'ed yet. I'll ping you when the PR is open.

PR is open here: #21236. It's a pure refactor and should be easy to review.

comments.body: Is moving those lines required? It makes automated review harder, so best to keep them where they were?
